objtitle.title: *The Spiritual Form of Nelson Guiding Leviathan*

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with some pen and ink outlining

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; sold from the collection of Thomas Butts, Jr., Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 70 (£1.2s. to "Robinson," probably a dealer); T. W. Jackson by no later than 1876; sold by the executors of Jackson's estate in 1914 to the Tate Gallery, now Tate Collection.

desc.objtitle:
The Spiritual Form of Nelson Guiding Leviathan,
Object 1 (Butlin 649)

physdesc.objnote: Blake included this tempera painting in his 1809 exhibition, number I in the accompanying *Descriptive Catalogue*, and in the 1812 exhibition of the Associated Painters in Water Colors, number 280 in the accompanying *Catalogue of the Fifth Annual Exhibition by the Associated Painters in Water Colors*.
